Introduction Introduction Established in 2011, ISMT is on a mission to contributing in Nepal's higher education by providing internationally recognized and industry relevant qualifications. In academic partnership with the University of Sunderland, UK, and Pearson Edexcel, UK, ISMT is redefining higher education with a bold vision—bridging the gap between academia and industry. ISMT's commitment to academic excellence is reflected in its inclusive and cost-effective educational approach, delivering international standards adopting core local values. The institution fosters a holistic learning environment that encourages active student engagement through project-based work, interactive discussions, presentations, and diverse assessment methodologies. Beyond academics, ISMT offers diverse range of extracurricular activities, including sports clubs, workshops, Bootcamps, and special interest groups, promoting the development of technical expertise alongside essential interpersonal, managerial, and leadership skills. At ISMT, students have the unique opportunity to earn prestigious UK qualifications without leaving Nepal, thereby gaining a competitive edge in the global job market. ISMT's dedication to providing a supportive and inclusive learning environment ensures that graduates are well-prepared to make meaningful contributions to their communities, nation, and the world at large. Why ISMT ? Why ISMT ? Why Study BTEC BSc.IT, and BHM at ISMT College? The changing world of the 21st century has a dire need for industry-relevant education. The education that prepares students to take initiation and demonstrate responsibilities in identifying, analyzing, and solving problems and can work in teams and make decisions in complex and unpredictable contexts and, most importantly, prepare them to be lifelong learners. Today the employers can choose employees from across the world, it is clear that the future competitiveness of students depends on the quality of education they receive. Considering these realities, ISMT offers internationally recognized degrees (BSc. (Hons) Computer Systems Engineering, BBA and BHM in collaboration with Pearson BTEC and The University of Sunderland, UK. The same courses (Pearson BTEC) are taught in Colleges and Universities in the UK and in other 173 countries. It is proven that these qualifications raise the knowledge, skills, and attitudes of its graduates so that they stand at the front line in the competitive market. This qualification is equivalent to the second year of a three-year university degree course. Thus, students who have achieved an HND can complete their Bachelor’s degree by enrolling directly to the third in a University. Actually, students have plenty of options ahead of them. They can complete their bachelor's degree at ISMT Nepal or can have their credit transferred to one of thousand Universities in Australia, USA, UK, Canada New Zealand or many more. Further, there are several visible reasons to study at ISMT college; ISMT has a "Placement and Internship Cell " to help its students and graduates for placement and internships. They also arrange a range of activities and events that help students develop their industry relevant personal and professional skill set. For example, we sent HM Graduates to China, Malaysia and Dubai to gain industry experience in relevant Hospitality Business. We arrange or facilitate internship opportunities to interested Computing and IT graduates or students to relevant IT companies. The college has in its resource pool of (overseas) lecturers, entrepreneurs, professionals and visiting professors who bring with them a wealth of experience backed up with academic excellence. The college provides all the resources such as libraries, E-library, computer labs and sports facilities. The faculty members are also selected from highly qualified subject experts, gifted lecturers with an invaluable fusion of teaching practice and current professional experience in relevant subject areas.

Frequently Asked Questions: BHM & BBA What Is BBA? BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) is a management degree designed to build your foundation in business strategy, leadership, marketing, finance, and administration. In Nepal, it is one of the most popular degrees among +2 graduates, especially those from management or science backgrounds. The program is offered by Tribhuvan University, Pokhara University, Kathmandu University, Purbanchal University, and international colleges affiliated with foreign universities. A BBA graduate is typically trained to work in banks, startups, NGOs, IT companies, or even government service. Many also choose the BBA route as a stepping stone to an MBA or specialized business or marketing career. What Is BHM? BHM (Bachelor of Hotel Management) is also an undergraduate degree focused on hospitality and tourism services. It combines classroom learning with practical training in hotel operations, guest relations, food and beverage management, front office management, and event handling. In Nepal, BHM is offered by colleges under Tribhuvan University, Pokhara University, Purbanchal University, and many international affiliations from varied countries. Students pursuing this course gain practical experience through training in college-operated model hotels and kitchens, as well as collaborations with hospitality businesses in Nepal and internationally. BHM graduates typically work in hotels, airlines, cruise lines, event companies, or tourism firms. The course is ideal for students who enjoy service, travel, and working with people. Similarities of BHM and BBA Both BHM and BBA are management courses. The end goal of learning any of these degrees is to operate and grow a business. This brings an overlapping list of skills, which must be taught to both BHM as well as BBA students. Management: Both need to plan, organize, and lead teams/operations. Finance: Both require understanding budgets and financial health. Marketing: Both need to attract customers (guests or buyers). HR: Both manage people effectively. Customer Focus: Both aim for satisfaction, be it guest or client. Operations: Both ensure smooth day-to-day processes. Ultimately, both BHM and BBA are about making a business succeed financially and operationally. A hotel (BHM focus) is still a business that needs profit, efficient processes, and happy customers, just like any other company (BBA focus). But the difference lies in their

approach, specialisation, classroom environments, and industry connections. So, Which is the better option, a BHM or a BBA? A BBA degree is a more favourable option for those interested in administrative or banking roles and are planning to pursue an MBA in future. It also builds a solid foundation for marketing and human resource management. BHM is great if you enjoy serving people, cooking or housekeeping. You can pursue a specialised MBA even after BHM.
